20080801.descr: A flaw in the reset token validation mechanism allows for non-validating tokens to be forged. This will allow an unauthenticated, unauthorized user to reset the password of the first enabled user (lowest id). Typically, this is an administrator user. Note, that changing the first users username may lessen the impact of this exploit (since the person who changed the password does not know the login associated with the new password). However, the only way to completely rectify the issue is to upgrade to 1.5.6 (or patch the /components/com_user/models/reset.php file).
20080801.title: Core - Password Remind Functionality

20080901.descr: A flaw in JRequest exists where variables set with JRequest::setVar are not cleaned when fetching the variable at a later point in the request.  This can result in variable injection (unwanted characters injected into returned data).
20080901.title: Core - JRequest Variable Injection

20080902.descr: A flaw with the random number generation exists which vastly reduces the entropy of system used random functions. This impacts system generated tokens and passwords. The fix increases entropy, and greatly reduces the chance of a generated token being guessed.
20080902.title: Core - Random Number Generation Flaw

20080903.descr: The mailto component does not verify validity of the URL prior to sending.
20080903.title: Core - com_mailto Spam

20080904.descr: Several components utilize a passed in URL to redirect to after processing.  These URLs are not validated prior to the redirect.  A crafted URL can cause the system to redirect to a spam or phishing site.
20080904.title: Core - Redirect Spam

20081101.descr: The defaults on com_content article submission allow entry of dangerous HTML tags (script, etc).  This only affects users with access level Author or higher, and only if you have not set filtering options in com_content configuration.
20081101.title: Core - com_content XSS vulnerability

20081102.descr: com_weblinks allows raw HTML into the title and description tags for weblink submissions (from both the administrator and site submission forms).
20081102.title: Core - com_weblinks XSS vulnerability

20090101.descr: When running a site under SSL ONLY (the entire site is forced to be under ssl), Joomla! does not set the SSL flag on the cookie.  This can allow someone monitoring the network to find the cookie related to the session.  Please note that all data is still transferred securely.
20090101.title: Core - JSession SSL Session Disclosure

20090102.descr: A crafted request can cause disclosure of the directory structure on the server (including any directory that php has access to).
20090102.title: Core - plg_xstandard Directory Traversal

20090301.descr: A series of XSS and CSRF faults exist in the administrator application.  Affected administrator components include com_admin, com_media, com_search.  Both com_admin and com_search contain XSS vulnerabilities, and com_media contains 2 CSRF vulnerabilities.
20090301.title: Core - Multiple XSS/CSRF

20090302.descr: A XSS vulnerability exists in the category view of com_content.
20090302.title: Core - com_content XSS

20090601.descr: A XSS vulnerability exists in the user view of com_users in the administrator panel.
20090601.title: Core - com_users XSS

20090602.descr: A XSS vulnerability exists in the JA_Purity template which ships with Joomla! 1.5.
20090602.title: Core - ja_purity XSS

20090603.descr: Some values were output from the database without being properly escaped.  Most strings in question were sourced from the administrator panel.
20090603.title: Core - Frontend XSS

20090604.descr: An attacker can inject JavaScript or DHTML code that will be executed in the context of targeted user browser, allowing the attacker to steal cookies. HTTP_REFERER variable is not properly parsed.
20090604.title: Core - Frontend XSS - HTTP_REFERER not properly filtered

20090605.descr: An attacker can inject JavaScript code in a URL that will be executed in the context of targeted user browser.
20090605.title: Core - Frontend XSS - PHP_SELF not properly filtered

20090606.descr: Some files were missing the check for JEXEC.  These scripts will then expose internal path information of the host.
20090606.title: Core - Missing JEXEC Check

20090722.descr: Tiny browser included with TinyMCE 3.0 editor allowed files to be uploaded and removed without logging in.
20090722.title: Core - File Upload

20090723.descr: In com_mailto, it was possible to bypass timeout protection against sending automated emails.
20090723.title: Core - com_mailto Timeout Issue

20091103.descr: When logged into the front end with Author access, it was possible to replace an article written by another user.
20091103.title: Core - Front-End Editor Issue

20100423.descr: If a user entered a URL with a negative query limit or offset, a PHP notice would display revealing information about the system.
20100423.title: Core - Negative Values for Limit and Offset

20151001.descr: Inadequate filtering of request data leads to a SQL Injection vulnerability.

20151002.descr: Inadequate ACL checks in com_contenthistory provide potential read access to data which should be access restricted.
20151002.title: Core - ACL Violations

20151201.descr: Browser information is not filtered properly while saving the session values into the database which leads to a Remote Code Execution vulnerability.
20151201.title: Core -  Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

20151202.descr: Add additional CSRF hardening in com_templates.
20151202.title: Core - CSRF Hardening

20151203.descr: Failure to properly sanitise input data from the XML install file located within an extension's package archive allows for directory traversal.
20151203.title: Core - Directory Traversal

20151204.descr: Inadequate filtering of request data leads to a Directory Traversal vulnerability.
20151204.title: Core - Directory Traversal

20151205.descr: Browser information is not filtered properly while saving the session values which leads to a Remote Code Execution vulnerability.
20151205.title: Session - Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

20151206.descr: The Joomla Security Strike team has been following up on the critical security vulnerability patched last week. Since the recent update it has become clear that the root cause is a bug in PHP itself. This was fixed by PHP in September of 2015 with the releases of PHP 5.4.45, 5.5.29, 5.6.13 (Note that this is fixed in all versions of PHP 7 and has been back-ported in some specific Linux LTS versions of PHP 5.3). This fixes the bug across all supported PHP versions.
20151206.title: Core - Session Hardening

20151207.descr: Inadequate filtering of request data leads to a SQL Injection vulnerability.
20151207.title: Core - SQL Injection

20160801.descr: Inadequate ACL checks in com_content provide potential read access to data which should be access restricted to users with edit_own level.
20160801.title: Core - ACL Violation

20160802.descr: Inadequate escaping leads to XSS vulnerability in mail component.
20160802.title: Core - XSS Vulnerability

20160803.descr: Add additional CSRF hardening in com_joomlaupdate.
20160803.title: Core - CSRF

20161001.descr: Inadequate checks allows for users to register on a site when registration has been disabled.
20161001.title: Core - Account Creation

20161002.descr: Incorrect use of unfiltered data allows for users to register on a site with elevated privileges.
20161002.title: Core - Elevated Privileges

20161003.descr: Incorrect use of unfiltered data allows for existing user accounts to be modified; to include resetting their username, password, and user group assignments.
20161003.title: Core - Account Modifications

20161201.descr: Incorrect use of unfiltered data stored to the session on a form validation failure allows for existing user accounts to be modified; to include resetting their username, password, and user group assignments.
20161201.title: Core - Elevated Privileges

20161202.descr: Inadequate filesystem checks allowed files with alternative PHP file extensions to be uploaded.
20161202.title: Core - Shell Upload

20161203.descr: Inadequate ACL checks in the Beez3 com_content article layout override enables a user to view restricted content.
20161203.title: Core - Information Disclosure

20161204.descr: Joomla! 3.6.5 includes additional security hardening mechanisms prepared by the JSST, thanks in part to issue reports from Fotis Evangelou and Nicholas Dionysopoulos, which restricts a user's ability to make potentially damaging configuration changes. This includes restricting the ability to set the "New User Registration Group" and "Guest User Group" to a group with Super User permissions and restricting the ability for a lesser privileged user to make user group assignment changes to users in a Super User group.
20161204.title: Misc. Security Hardening

20161205.descr: All versions of the third-party PHPMailer library distributed with Joomla! versions up to 3.6.5 are vulnerable to a remote code execution vulnerability. This is patched in PHPMailer 5.2.20 which will be included with Joomla! 3.7. After analysis, the JSST has determined that through correct use of the JMail class, there are additional validations in place which make executing this vulnerability impractical within the Joomla environment. As well, the vulnerability requires being able to pass user input to a message's "from" address; all places in the core Joomla API which send mail use the sender address set in the global configuration and does not allow for user input to be set elsewhere. However, extensions which bundle a separate version of PHPMailer or do not use the Joomla API to send email may be vulnerable to this issue.
20161205.title: PHPMailer Security Advisory

20170401.descr: Mail sent using the JMail API leaked the used PHPMailer version in the mail headers.
20170401.title: Core - Information Disclosure

20170402.descr: Inadequate filtering leads to XSS in the template manager component.
20170402.title: Core - XSS Vulnerability

20170403.descr: Inadequate filtering of multibyte characters leads to XSS vulnerabilities in various components.
20170403.title: Core - XSS Vulnerability

20170404.descr: Inadequate filtering of specific HTML attributes leads to XSS vulnerabilities in various components.
20170404.title: Core - XSS Vulnerability

20170405.descr: Inadequate escaping of file and folder names leads to XSS vulnerabilities in the template manager component.
20170405.title: Core - XSS Vulnerability

20170406.descr: Inadequate filtering of form contents lead allow to overwrite the author of an article.
20170406.title: Core - ACL Violations

20170407.descr: Inadequate mime type checks allowed low-privilege users to upload swf files even if they were explicitly forbidden.
20170407.title: Core - ACL Violations

20170408.descr: Multiple files caused full path disclosures on systems with enabled error reporting.
20170408.title: Core - Information Disclosure

20170501.descr: Inadequate filtering of request data leads to a SQL Injection vulnerability.
20170501.title: Core - SQL Injection

20170701.descr: Improper cache invalidation leads to disclosure of form contents.
20170701.title: Core - Information Disclosure

20170702.descr: Missing CSRF token checks and improper input validation lead to an XSS vulnerability.
20170702.title: Core - XSS Vulnerability

20170703.descr: Inadequate filtering of multibyte characters leads to XSS vulnerabilities in various components.
20170703.title: Core - XSS Vulnerability
